Patient Particulars: Name: Lucy; Sex: Female; Marital status: Unmarried; Education: Graduation (pursuing); Occupation: Student
Presenting Complaints (Symptoms):
1. Low mood
2. Lack of motivation
3. Feelings of worthlessness
4. Fatiguability
5. Disturbed sleep (quality)
History: Precipitating factor: Exam stress; Total duration: 6 months; Present history: Patient was maintaining well until 6 months ago when she took a lot of stress for exams as she wanted to perform well. Her parents were having a hard time with their marriage which added to her stress. She has been living away from home with her university friends. She has been feeling low and doesn't share this with anyone; Premorbid personality: Use of leisure time- going out, sports
Current Mental Status Examination: Behaviour: Patient was cooperative and rapport could be established; Mood: Depressed; Affect: Restricted; Thought: content- reflected worthlessness
Issues discussed in Current Session: Patient expressed experiencing low mood, fatiguability and feelings of worthlessness most of the time. It started during her exams when she took a lot of stress about it. During the same time her parents also started having marital issues which made things worse for the patient and she felt guilty about it. She has been facing decreased sleep quality and feelings of isolation. She refrains from spend time or talking with her parents as it makes her feel bad.
Clinical Diagnosis by Reviewer: F32.0 Major Depressive Disorder, single episode mild
